website_summaries.verdict: A basic set of mud flaps for most trucks and SUVs. Good for older vehicles needing new flaps.
pros: Rubber material is flexible and strong for most weather and road conditions
Flaps are just wide enough to cover most typical tires while fitting in the wheel well
cons: Mud flaps are not suitable for larger vehicles with wider tires
Poor coverage with off road tires

customer_reviews.title: I used them for mudflaps on my cargo trailer. ...
customer_reviews.text: I used them for mudflaps on my cargo trailer. It required cutting them down a few inches to adjust length.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I put these on our travel trailer/camper that had no mud flaps but I had noticed that the bottom of the camper had gotten very wet during one trip where it had rained. The floor is only OSB which is very susceptible to moisture and the mud flaps did a pretty good job of knocking down the road spray. These hold on pretty well, I am only concerned that the rubber may rip out at the screw holes. But, so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Lolly V

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap flexible mudflaps. Replaced rigid plastic stock ones that kept getting torn off when parking in snowbanks. These take a beating, flex out of the way, then go right back to where they should be. They also shed debris easier so they don't get those massive built up chunks of crud when driving in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: custom fit to my jeep
customer_reviews.text: used these to make mud flaps to custom fit my jeep with aftermarket removable flares. Lots of dirt roads and with all the snow melt that occurs the jeep was a muddy mess. Wife drives the jeep with a 2 year old and was sick of getting muddy and the kid muddy. These made a huge difference. Got another set to make a pair for the rear flares.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Nix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for utility trailers
customer_reviews.text: I have installed these on both of my utility trailers. The length and width are perfect . I've read some people have had difficulty removing the packaging staples, but I see no big problem. Just bend up the staple tabs and remove them with a pair of pliers. These "mud flaps" are also flexible and save the tail lights from being hit with debris from the tires.
customer_reviews.author: Old timer

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart on the first trip.
customer_reviews.text: Very displeased. While they were easy to install, one came apart on the very first trip (less than 200 miles). It appears as if a tear started where the product is stabled to the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I thought they would be.
customer_reviews.text: This was a pleasant surprise! I wasnt expecting much at all for the price, but seems to be pretty good. I suggest using some type of aluminum strips or something to kinda sandwich them to the fender , but other than that there great.
customer_reviews.author: jeff h.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. Worth is 100%
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Installed on my ezgo txt because there is a large and pesky gap where any sand or water or anything that you run through sprays on the feet of the people sitting on the back. These worked quite well. They could stand to be a bit wider but they did their job as described. Also had to cut about an inch and a half or so of the length.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Great for making a license plate frame.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot comment to their performance as a mud flap. However, they work nicely for cutting out a flexible frame for mounting the license plate to my utility trailer. The plastic stock frame broke and I nearly lost the plate. So I bought these to create a frame that can flex when bumped into. Firm rubber, decent thickness, I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I required.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my Polaris RZR. They are easily modified and cut to the size I needed. I seen the price of mud flaps for the RZR's and knew I could make my own brackets using these rubber flaps I made them to protect the rear trailing arms and help keeps rocks from hitting to engine. When these become damaged, I'll purchase another set, cut them as necessary.
customer_reviews.author: bebee33

customer_reviews.title: great for RV's
customer_reviews.text: Work great on my travel trailer. Seems like they are sturdy, thick and will last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sund

customer_reviews.title: seem to be good quality
customer_reviews.text: the flaps are heavy duty and work well. I have no idea why they put staples right through the flaps. You have to be careful removing them so as to not damage the flaps.
customer_reviews.author: oldmill322

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty but product packaging is brutal
customer_reviews.text: Excellent heavy duty flaps, but the cardboard label is stapled with ultra heavy duty staples that go right through both flaps! The flaps tore when I tried to remove them. Overkill and why damage them before the customer sees them is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good Cheap Flaps
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a 2012 ford focus. Cut them to fit and bolted them on with stainless fasteners. These actual rubber ones work way better than the plastic like ones for cold climates. The plastic ones crack at -40 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer of Things

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great price and thick, strong rubber. Comes with 6 screws, but you will need to add washers to insure the guards stay put. I put them on a pop-up trailer and fit like a glove. They should work on a small truck, but they are not wide enough for a full size tire.
customer_reviews.author: Lon R. Widdicombe

customer_reviews.title: Used on my trailer
customer_reviews.text: After replacing a second set of trailer lights due to rocks kicking up and busting them, I used these to help prevent future busted lights.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We put these on our camper and wish we would of a long time ago. Fit perfect and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Viki

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: These are very strudy. Worked very well on trailer. Flaps are pre-drilled. These flaps are for narrow tires. Worked very well for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Torn off by wind flapping it back and forth.  Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Too poorly made. The bolts and top strip were still on but the rest tore off.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: fits
customer_reviews.text: Installed on the front fenders of my 2019 Wrangler JL Unlimited. perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Matti

customer_reviews.title: Too small.
customer_reviews.text: Too small. Definitely not for a Jeep. These should only be for really small cars.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Material is very thick and sturdy yet flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Splash guards
customer_reviews.text: Not installed. Bought for grandsons vehicle but already had splash guards
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits Canam SxS 1000  Mudflap brackets
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm On my Canam 1000! The Holes on the flap even matched up the bracket on the back of the side by side! Can't beat that ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Brother Reed

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: not bad for the price. i will customize myself and itll still look better and be cheaper than the rally armor brand.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Still on
customer_reviews.text: Has stayed on for many miles however they are a bit thin around the areas designated for screwing in
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Check size
customer_reviews.text: Came on time smaller then I thought they would be
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Correct item
customer_reviews.text: Should have ordered two sets. Bought them for my mini truck and am sure they will serve the purpose. Probably gonn order more sets.
customer_reviews.author: William Turner

customer_reviews.title: Well made, straightforward.
customer_reviews.text: Best fit for my application, these suited my project well.
customer_reviews.author: Ladykay64

customer_reviews.title: cool for 2014 corolla s
customer_reviews.text: look good...you have to screw these in....i used a few screws and just screwed into the plastic fender liner
customer_reviews.author: Josh Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Small but durable
customer_reviews.text: Too small for my track I had no place to mount them in the back so there to high up . But great for cars
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L.

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed material.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived as listed and worked fine. I actually used them to put on my Kawasaki side by side.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Cawley

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Held up to 30 miles of rocky ravel road. Very pleased with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to the fenders on your utility trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Size and fit as advertised. Fit to the fenders on trailer. Added stainless hardware and a flat metal backing plate.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money on better mudflaps
customer_reviews.text: These mudflaps rip a little to easy!😠 but that’s what you get for cheap mudflaps. And the hardware could be better they gave wood screws not self tapping screws!😡
customer_reviews.author: War dog

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for enclosed trailer fenders
customer_reviews.text: Perfect mud flaps for my 7x16 Leonard enclosed trailer, easy to install and cut to size.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a smaller mud flap for my boat trailer. These were perfect. Good quality. Good Price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I fabricated these to the front of the front fenders, look great
customer_reviews.author: Steve Magnetti

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be heavy duty enough for a flap on my motorcycle trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Used on my Ranger flatbed , very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: E. Paul Lewandoski

customer_reviews.title: Mud flaps
customer_reviews.text: Very thick and work great. No bolts to mount with but no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Kleinschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Seem like they'll hold up well
customer_reviews.text: Quite hefty and stiff. Seem like they'll hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: MikeS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and the material is flexible so it won't break during a Minnesota winter.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Put them on a boat trailer to keep the wheels from throwing mud up on the boat, Looks nice...works even better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLAND MUDFLAP
customer_reviews.text: perfect fit for my trailer feels like a good pliable mud flap not brittle !
customer_reviews.author: Wisconsin Golpher

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work well on my utility trailer. Be careful pulling staples so you don't tear mud flaps.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Allen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit great on my f350 plow truck easy install and cheap!
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Who's ever idea it was to package them with staples was awful the mud flaps tore from the holes the staples left And there just cheap
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: ... exact size I was looking for and they worked great.
customer_reviews.text: These were the exact size I was looking for and they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene ladegast

customer_reviews.title: flimsy
customer_reviews.text: ended up not using due to them being on the small side. they are not very flexable and are very thin. not overly impressed
customer_reviews.author: mythoughtsonit

customer_reviews.title: Quality product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty heavy duty. I have not installed yet but imagine they will hold up to what I need them for. These are universal so depending on vehicle they are being installed on some cutting may be required
customer_reviews.author: JaJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One fell off my vehicle they are good in snow and wet cond
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Moore

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy duty and I'm confident they'll last for years!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Goodwin

product_meta.title: Highland 1058000 Black Splash Guard - 2 Piece
product_meta.description: Highland Black Splash Guards are designed to prevent mud and small rocks from being thrown up against the body of the vehicle or from being thrown at a following vehicle. These splash guards include mounting hardware for easy installation and are backed by limited lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Withstands extreme heat and sub-zero temperatures
Includes mounting hardware for easy installation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars186 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
